metadata.description: Set up Azure Policy to ensure Azure Network Watchers are deployed when vnets are created. They will be deployed to networkWatcherRG.
By default Azure Defender for Kubernetes Service, Container Registry, and Key Vault are configured to deploy via Azure Policy, use this parameter to disable that.

By default Azure Defender for Kubernetes Service, Container Registry, and Key Vault are enabled; use this parameter to prevent them from being enabled. Deploying these requires subscription Owner or Security Admin roles.

resources.name: [variables('rgName-Hubs')]
resources.comments: This contains all of our regional hubs. Typically this would be found in your enterprise's Connectivity subscription.

resources.name: [variables('rgName-Spokes')]
resources.comments: This contains all of our regional spokes. Typically this would be found in your enterprise's Connectivity subscription or in the workload's subscription.

resources.name: [variables('rgName-bu0001A0005')]
resources.comments: This is the resource group for BU001A0005. Typically this would be found in your workload's subscription.

resources.name: [variables('rgName-NetworkWatchers')]
resources.comments: This is the resource group for Azure Network Watchers. These are singletons per region and this RG will only be deployed if no existing Network Watchers are found in your subscription.
